Joakim Ohlrogge wrote:

> How do you use the rule "the simplest thing that could possibly work?"
> I think it is hard to argue witht someone else that "this is simpler
> than that" but you can keep /yourself/ from doing things in a more
> complicated manner than absolutely necessary.

I think it's easy. Start with "fewer lines of code" as a measure of 
simplicity. When you get to the first counterexample, add the next 
ingredient...

Take care.
